Detailed Description

Class RankGroup is used to manage a set of ranks, namely a subset of the available ranks in a parallel run.

This class allows a group of ranks to be constructed as a generalized subset of ranks, represented by an array passed to the constructor, or as a contiguous ordered subset of ranks, the range from a minimum to a maximum rank value. It also has a default case where it represents the full set of available ranks, from 0 to P-1, P being the number of available processors.

If N is the number of ranks in the represented subset, the class gives the user a 1-to-1 mapping between the integer set [0,N-1] and the ranks in the subset.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::RankGroup (  ) 

The default constructor constructs a RankGroup representing the full set of available ranks. It will use all of the ranks in the MPI communicator used by the SAMRAI MPI object. If a different communicator is desired, then use a constructor with a communicator argument.

SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::RankGroup ( const SAMRAI_MPI &  d_samrai_mpi  )  [explicit]

This constructor constructs a RankGroup representing the full set of available ranks in the given communicator.

SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::RankGroup ( const int  min,
const int  max,
const SAMRAI_MPI &  samrai_mpi = SAMRAI_MPI(SAMRAI_MPI::getSAMRAIWorld()) 
)

This constructor creates a RankGroup consisting of all ranks from min to max, inclusive. min must be >= 0 and max must be less than the total number of available processors.

Precondition:
min >= 0

min <= max

SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::RankGroup ( const Array< int > &  rank_group,
const SAMRAI_MPI &  samrai_mpi = SAMRAI_MPI(SAMRAI_MPI::getSAMRAIWorld()) 
) [explicit]

This constructor creates a RankGroup consisting of ranks corresponding to the integers in the array. Each member of the array must be >= 0, less than the total number of available processors, and unique within the array. Due to the use of an array for storage, RankGroups created with this constructor should be expected to be less efficient than those created with the above min/max constructor.

Precondition:
!rank_group.empty()

SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::~RankGroup (  ) 

Destructor

Member Function Documentation

bool SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::containsAllRanks (  )  const [inline]

Returns true if the RankGroup contains ranks for all available processors.

void SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::setMinMax ( const int  min,
const int  max 
) [inline]

Set the minimum and maximum ranks for the RankGroup. All previous state of this object will be eliminated. The restrictions on the arguments are the same as for the constructor that takes the min/max arguments.

bool SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::isMember ( const int  rank  )  const

Return true if the given rank is contained in the RankGroup.

int SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::size (  )  const

Return the size of the subset of ranks represented by this RankGroup.

int SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::getMappedRank ( const int  index  )  const

Given an integer identifier from the set [0,N-1], N being the size of the RankGroup, return a unique rank from the RankGroup according to a 1-to-1 mapping.

int SAMRAI::tbox::RankGroup::getMapIndex ( const int  rank  )  const

This is the inverse function of getMappedRank. Given a rank that is contained in the RankGroup, return a unique integer identifier in the set [0,N-1], N being the size of the rank group, according to a 1-to-1 mapping.

Precondition:
rank >= 0
